availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Henry T. Snyder (Boone County, Kentucky, farmer and justice of the peace)

body.p: Boone County, Kentucky, farmer and justice of the peace. Kentucky native. Married to Sarah Snyder. Father of James P. Snyder, Julius F. Snyder, Sarah E. Snyder, and Eliza Snyder. Farmer in Boone County in 1860. Owned twelve enslaved persons in 1860. Justice of the peace in the 4th District of Boone County in 1865.

bibl.p: Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedule, Kentucky, Boone County, Verona, p. 238; Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Boone, Florence, p. 3; KYR-0001-007-0359.
